projects.name: Together Apart
projects.subtitle: Co-Designing A Robot Interface for Remote Co-Design
projects.abstract: A long term co-design project with KidsTeam UW to design a remote and hybrid tangible co-design tool. We utilize Sony toio robots to build a networked robot platform that child designers and their adult design partners can use to collaborate in real time. Through this project, we gain insights about tangible co-design tools for remote and hybrid contexts.

projects.name: Presence Mat
projects.subtitle: Low-Cost Room-Scale Radar for the Home with Off-The-Shelf Hardware
projects.abstract: A system built with off-the-shelf Ultra-High frequency RFID to create a room-scale radar system. Using deep learning Presence Mat approximates body position for yoga-based interaction.

projects.name: Cyber Garden
projects.subtitle: Ambient Community Wellness Display
projects.abstract: An ambient display that invites students and faculty in to share and reflect on their stress as a community. With a combination of self-reported and biometric data, the community controls robotic flowers that close or bloom as a representation of stress in the community.

projects.name: Scent Bots
projects.subtitle: Automatic Roving Scents for Ambient Telepresence using Object Recognition
projects.abstract: A swarm robot modification for spatial smell based telepresence. Using a top down camera and object recognition algorithm, the position and smell of an item placed on a tabletop can be simulated in a remote space. We design a mechanism to bring scent to a swarm robot context while also exploring the nature of spatial scent in ambient telepresence.

projects.name: DOT
projects.subtitle: Device for Object Based Telepresence
projects.abstract: A platform that utilizes tabletop swarm robots to create a dynamic tangible display. The system recognizes the identity of objects placed on the surface, a paired display reacts to this configuration. Created for the 2021 UIST Student Innovation Challenge.

projects.name: VTTV
projects.subtitle: Vibrotactile Tongue Display
projects.abstract: VTTV is a seven segment vibrotactile tongue display that allows users to combine taste and vibration to create haptic art for the tongue. The system provides a unique platform for crafting playful, flavorful, vibrotactile experiences. This project recieved honorable mention in the Student Design Competition at World Haptics Conference 2020.

projects.name: Everything Instrument
projects.subtitle: Turn Anything Into an Instrument
projects.abstract: For the SynthUX 2021 hackathon, we presented Everything Instrument, a platform that allows people to turn anything into an instrument using copper tape. After applying copper tape to everyday household objects, users attach their creation to Everything Instrument, using buttons to customize the pitch and character of their sound.
